title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery responds to online critic by launching 'Bye Bridget' merchandise to support charities.
The bakery donates a portion of sales to White Bear Area Food Shelf, sparking criticism from an online troll.
Owner Natalie Hug uses charity and humor against negativity, with 'Bye Bridget' proceeds supporting further charitable work.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gerard 'Jerry' Boucher, 72, and Kathleen 'Kit' Boucher, 71, died after falling through ice at Bee’s River in Eastham.
The Bouchers' daughter, Katy, memorialized them on Facebook, highlighting their community contributions and asking for gestures of kindness in their honor.
Visitation for the Bouchers will take place at St. Joan of Arc Church, Orleans on Feb. 27-28, with a private burial in West Hartford.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three fires in Fitchburg are being investigated as arson, according to State Fire Marshal Jon Davine.
Two fires occurred at a large apartment building on Blossom and Day streets on February 14 and 15.
A third fire on Myrtle Avenue on February 18 injured one person and displaced seven, with no believed connection to the other fires.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, 53, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died from ALS less than a year after diagnosis.
Dane became an ALS awareness advocate and received the ALS Network's Advocate of the Year award in September 2025.
Dane's memoir, 'Book of Days: A Memoir in Moments,' scheduled for release in late 2026, reflects on his life's key moments.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police troopers face manslaughter charges related to Enrique Delgado-Garcia's 2024 death during a training exercise.
Lt. Jennifer Penton and Troopers Edwin Rodriguez, David Montanez, and Casey LaMonte were suspended with pay after duty status hearings.
An independent investigation led to charges of serious bodily injury and involuntary manslaughter against the trainer accused of lying under oath.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police warned about a planned takeover at South Shore Plaza on Friday evening, promoted via social media.
Authorities are preparing with an operational plan, coordinating with law enforcement due to previous violent takeovers.
Past takeovers involved street blockades with car stunts, leading to incidents like a police cruiser being set on fire.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins considers the Celtics a 'dark horse' for the 2026 title if Jayson Tatum returns from injury.
Despite key player departures, the Celtics hold a 35-19 record, second in the Eastern Conference.
Jaylen Brown's performance has made him an MVP contender, with top-five rankings in scoring and defensive stats.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: ESPN's Seth Walder suggests Patriots trade a 2026 first, third, and sixth-round pick for AJ Brown and a second-round pick.
AJ Brown, coming off a 1,003-yard season, is seen as a fit due to his past success with coach Mike Vrabel.
The trade proposal would leave Patriots with two second-round picks and three sixth-round picks for the 2026 draft.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots are considering Kyle Pitts as a top free-agent target to strengthen their pass-catching options.
Pitts recorded 88 receptions for 928 yards and five touchdowns in 2025 and earned Second Team All-Pro honors.
A four-year, $70 million contract for Pitts is projected, potentially offering a more affordable option than pricey wideouts.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, of Provincetown, pleaded guilty to charges of possession and distribution of child pornography.
Law enforcement began investigating Pagnoni following a tip about his distribution of child sexual abuse material in March 2023.
Pagnoni's sentencing is set for May 12, facing up to 20 years in prison and a $250,000 fine per charge.
